snippet: The suit, which is seeking class-action status, contends that the retailer has a policy of racial discrimination to bolster its “brand image.”
abstract: Three former managers at Wet Seal, a nationwide apparel retailer for young women, file a federal race discrimination lawsuit, asserting that the company had a high-level policy of firing and denying pay increases and promotions to African-American employees because they did not fit its brand image; suit seeks class-action status.
lead_paragraph: The suit, which is seeking class-action status, contends that the retailer has a policy of racial discrimination to bolster its “brand image.”

headline.seo: Wet Seal Accused of Racial Bias by 3 Ex-Managers
headline.main: Lawsuit Claims Race Bias at Wet Seal Retail Chain
